newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Barco sets up Indian unit, joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Barco sets up Indian unit, joint venture.

text.p: Belgian electronics group Barco said on Monday it set up both a 100 percent subsidiary and a joint venture in India.

The New-Delhi-based subsidiary will be responsible for research and development and for sales and marketing of projectors. The joint venture, with Indian company Fusebase Eltoro Ltd, was set up for the production of projectors in India, it said.
Barco said the agreement with Fusebase, part of the Hotline group, was aimed at offering projectors which "meet the specific demands of the Indian market".
Barco, which has a 60 percent stake in the joint venture, said production of locally-developed projectors would start from the third quarter of this year.
In 1995, Barco had already set up an initial subsidiary in the southern Indian city of Bangalore for the support of sales activities of the Barco Graphics division.
